p: To produce superior quality fruit, the ‘Mato Peiyu’ tree must be pruned. Pruning results in many unused leaves and branches becoming agricultural waste. In Taiwanese folk culture, bathing with pomelo leaves on Chinese New Year’s Eve was believed to ward off bad luck and prevent illness. Pomelo leaves exhibit a mind calming effect. Additionally, pomelo-leaf baths help dredge the meridian and promote blood circulation [ 3]. Drinking boiled pomelo leaf water was a traditional therapy to treat headache and stomach pain. If the bioactivities of pomelo leaves could be identified, this agricultural waste can be recycled and reused, thereby increasing the commercial value of local crops.
